pages.text: Ceratodus was a genus of lungfish that first emerged during the Triassic, and may have survived to as late as the Eocene. It seemingly had a global distribution, with its fossils having been found on every continent except Antarctica. Its closest living relative is thought to be the similar-looking Queensland lungfish of Australia.
